abstract: Otis introduces an escalator that combines regenerative braking with a standby feature: the escalator slows when no one is on it. The new model also uses LEDs for illumination, further cutting energy use.
snippet: Otis introduces an escalator that combines regenerative braking with a standby feature: the escalator slows when no one is on it. The new model also uses LEDs for illumination, further cutting energy use.
lead_paragraph: Regenerative braking, which involves taking unwanted mechanical energy and turning it back into electricity instead of letting it dissipate as heat, is well established in cars like the Toyota Prius and has lately made inroads in railway locomotives.

headline.main: An Escalator That Feeds the Building
